fields.description:
I have Confluence 1.3.1 loaded on my test box with no imported data.  During the set up process, I specified SQL Server as the external db.  In the load content step, I specified that a file which is the daily backup file I copied from another system (production; see attached) be the file from which the system should restore.  This step resulted in the following error:

net.sf.hibernate.JDBCException: could not retrieve version: [com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.Notification#1] 

In the Tomcat dump, I also see a message like:

2005-01-27 17:05:26,862 ERROR [confluence.importexport.impl.BackupImporter] Can
not import the entities!

Please advise. 

Thanks.

cran
fields.summary: Error Restoring Data after switching to SQL Sql server db

fields.description:
We use plugins now, not custommacros.

Also update project.properties to build its macros from plugins instead of custommacros.
fields.summary: move src/etc/custommacro code to src/etc/plugins

fields.description:
Hi,

Have recently installed 1.4-DR3 - made a new page and on that page there are some links to external sites. Added the page without and problem and it renders correctly, however when I click the "More" link to turn on notifications of changes I get a NullPointerException.

The strange thing is that I have another page that I created in 1.4-DR2 which also has external links and it works fine, I can visit the "More" action and turn on the notifications.

I'll attach the error page for your information.

Regards,

pj.
fields.summary: NullPointerException on "More" of page with outgoing links

fields.description:
The mail archive view:

a) shows way too many navigation links at the top when there's a lot of mail
b) tries to load every mail just to display those links, which blows up Confluence if there's a lof of mail.

Fix both.
fields.summary: Better mail archive page
Enable performance testing for Oracle 10g drivers on restoration of large archives

fields.description:
Decorators, or layouts, for spaces should be versioned, just as pages are. 

Making a critical error leaves no way of rolling back the problem.
fields.summary: Versioning of decorators / layouts, as for pages

fields.description:
During the restore of an archive, certain attempts to rebuild the lucene index with attachments can result in a stack-trace (to be attached).

Fix - perhaps rebuild the index after the restoration of all content?
fields.summary: Indexing on attachments during install fails

fields.description:
Tried to finish setup but had not run through the whole wizard?

This has begun happening now, after every restore during a set up.
fields.summary: Tried to finish setup but had not run through the whole wizard?

fields.description:
This seems to be this problem:

  http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=6189&tstart=0

Outlined by this bug report:

  http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=4541

This appears to still be a problem - I had one other user report this
this morning:


"Confluence?? Since is
built on top of Spring/Hibernate and Lucene .. was a second nature for
me to understand it and install it. I was even able to install it on a
mySQL server supporting utf-8 as the default collation .. moment when
the default installation failed (osproperties failed .. for index key
too long .. BTW I hope you know about this issue, do you?! I wonder if
any of your customers complained so far about this issue: Confluence on
mySQL with utf-8 enabled. If not, it means I am the only one seeing this
problem, which is good :)"

Can we raise an issue, and look to fix it?
fields.summary: index key too long - os_propertyentry when MySQL

fields.description:
Importing a confluence archive creates two velocity directories:

conf_home/velocity/velocity

then begins including the space specific directories. There should only be one velocity directory.
fields.summary: Confluence import creates two velocity directories instead of one (breaking decorators)

fields.description:
This seems to happen with increasing frequency.  Anyone know why?

If not - can we create a script that the contegix guys can run when the
box dies, so we can find out the problem?

-----------------
Email:
confluence.atlassian.com set off alarms at 12:05 PM CST on January 1, 2004.  The site was unresponsive, while atlassian01 as a whole was mostly idle.  The service was restarted at 12:10.  All sites are currently online.

  If there is anything we can do to further assist, please do not hesitate to contact Contegix support anytime.

Cheers,
-craig
fields.summary: Analysis script for Contegix

fields.description:
For each incoming mail, check that the message-id does not already exist for this space. If it exists, silently discard.

This makes mbox imports and POP checking idempotent, for example.
fields.summary: Do not import a mail message if it matches an existing message-id in the same space

fields.description:
There should be a content summary view where you can see all the attachments within a space.

This should be easy to throw together - use Lucene rather than Hibernate, as the queries to find all attachments across the different content types would be quite nasty.
fields.summary: List all attachments for a space

fields.description: This might be similar to CONF-1080.  I would like to have a section under the "Page Operations" section with my favorite links.  At a minimum, I'd like to be able to populate the list myself.  Even better would be to automatically populate it with my most-frequently-visited pages.  Then for any pages I mark as a "favorite", they would always stay at the top, followed by my most-frequently-visited pages.
fields.summary: Create personal links section

fields.description:
When I move a page to a new space, an option to also move all children (and update appropriate link) would be a big timesaver.

This would be a really useful option.  I just spend 20 minutes moving a bunch of pages to a new space and re-creating the hierarchy by manually re-assigning all the parent/child relationships.  With this feature, it would have taken 30 seconds...and be much less error-prone.
fields.summary: Moving a page to another space should move the children

fields.description: The list of user macros is not sorted, and when you add a new macro the list order changes.  I would guess they are coming out of a HashMap iterator.  It would be a lot easier to use if it was sorted like a TreeMap.
fields.summary: User macros are listed in random order

fields.description: I suspect our thumbnailing code parses the URL with something like lastIndexOf("attachments"), which is broken if the file itself contains that string.
fields.summary: Can't thumbnail a file called attachments.png

fields.description: If I launch the parent page picker from the edit page, I shouldn't be allowed to choose pages from other spaces - searches, history and recent changes should all be pruned to only the space I can choose parents from.
fields.summary: The parent page picker allows you to choose illegal parents

fields.description:
The emails we send out when a file is attached should have the attachment name (ie myfile.gif) linked to download the attachment.

Also, we don't include the user's comment in the outgoing email.
fields.summary: Improve file attachmented email notifications

fields.description:
Add a global preference (on by default) that causes every external link to include a rel="nofollow" attribute.

This is the Google-supported tag that should prevent search engines following the link, as a way of discouraging comment- and wiki-spam.

See: http://www.google.com/googleblog/2005/01/preventing-comment-spam.html
fields.summary: Support rel="nofollow" for external links

fields.description: When visiting a blog post (news) from the dashboard the calendar does not display but when following a link from recently updated it does - this is inconsistent.
fields.summary: viewing Blog Posts should always display a calendar

improve exception messages during restore of an archive

There should be an obvious link for the inexperienced (like me).

Thanks.

Jim Cant

when I went to this place, http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Documentation+Home
All I saw was raw html
fields.summary: can't read documentation; displays as raw html

fields.description:
I tried to move a page and it was hard.  I clicked move page on the right and got a dialog with a drop down list that had only the top-level places in our heirarchy with the current location being excluded.  I wanted to move the page to a place lower in the tree and couldn't do it.  Someone finally pointed out that there was a 'parent page' edit control at the bottom the screen when editing a page and by putting the new parent in there I was able to move it.

I at first tried to drag and drop the folder to its new location but that didn't work.

My suggestion would be that in the move dialog that pops up when 'move' is clicked that there be a browse button that would let one browse to the new page (folder) that should be the destination of the move.
fields.summary: Usability issue: hard to move pages.

fields.description:
Word Document not being indexed.
There is only one copy of "Database Versioning - Howto.doc" in the attachments dir and it opens up in word just fine. 
However it I search in confluence for text it contains, it is not in the results.

I found this error in the log files:
2005-01-20 15:54:09,188 ERROR [search.lucene.mapping.AttachmentLuceneDocumentFactory] Error extracting text from attachment: Database Versioning - Howto.doc

fields.summary: Word Document not being indexed.
Import pages from disk should import as attachments
POP timing on email archive support

fields.description:
We've recently rolled out Confluence, and I notice that often a new user will use the "comment" feature, when it would work better to insert their comments (perhaps in italics, possibly signed) into the page itself.  When someone throws out an idea in a new page and  notifies others to take a look, the natural new user inclination is that those looking will use the Comment feature. 

Comments can't be edited, so if a part of the comment becomes obsolete or wrong, you can't fix it (without creating a new comment and deleting the old.) 

Comments can't be interspersed with the existing text, so sometimes the context of a comment is confusing or has to be explicitly stated rather than implied by its location as an edit would.

Replies to comments can't be interspersed with the original commenters' thoughts.  


How to improve this?

If a person has edit rights to a page, and selects Comment, put up a page that suggests they may want to consider using Edit instead, (listing justifications such as above).  The user would be able to configure their profile to suppress this notification after they "get it."

If a page is "brainstorming" type of page that expects lots of discussion, it might also be useful to tag the page to only permit comments from users who do not have edit rights.

In summary, the only real advantage to comments that I see, is in a high volume situation where comments don't result in concurrent edit conflicts.  In smaller organizations, conflicts may not be a big enough problem to justify it.
fields.summary: Discourage and/or disallow comments when page is editable

fields.description:
It would be nice to deactivate the automatic polling of mail accounts. For now I set an invalid password, but Confluence complains about that with a NullPointerException. Whether Confluence should poll a mail account or not should be set with a checkbox.

Because there'll probably more of options like this it would be nice to have a separate page where one could configure the mail accounts.

fields.description:
I'm writing some HTML documentation which mixes up code examples and actual formatting. I've found that is a small problem with the {html} macro, but I'm finding that URL encoding doesn't work
(<b>) and gets interpretted as an actual <b> tag. I realise that the {html} macro is probably doing some encoding of it's own anyway, so this is probably really tricky to fix. Perhaps note this in documentation?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2603].
  {panel}

Hello,

I have been trying to configure Confluence to look like a normal web site when users are not logged in. I have managed to create a theme that hides the page operations and home, spaces, administration links and places a navigation bar on the left side of the page. 

But, there are still the attachments, children and comment bars visible to anonymous users. I would like to be able to:

1. Hide comments from some user groups. So a separate view permission for comments would be needed.

2. Hide all but the page text from the anonymous users. Currently these parts (comment, attachment, children bars) are not accessible to themes. Could you make them available for layout changes?
fields.summary: Hide attachments, comments and children bars from some users

fields.description:
I'd like to point to LaTeX as a viable and useful output format.  Among other things, this would allow people to build their own PDFs (via PDFLaTeX) that look a lot prettier than anything XSL-FO can currently do, and it would be useful for people who want to use Confluence as an authoring platform.  Ideally, the macro-like nature of Confluence would make it relatively simple to concoct a mapping, e.g.:

{noformat}...{noformat} --> \begin{verbatim}...\end{verbatim}
fields.summary: LaTeX export.

fields.description:
Method API: deleteAllPermissionsForGroup(String groupname)
Method Description: Delete all permissions (global and space level) permissions for the group with given name. Method may be useful if a group cannot be deleted because it has permissions attached to it. May be necessary to delete all permissions from the group prior to deleting group. Alternatively a boolean argument can be specified in deleteGroup which indicates a force delete.
fields.summary: deleteAllPermissionsForGroup

fields.description:
Method API: boolean deleteGroup(String groupname, String defaultGroupName)
Method Description: Delete group with name groupname. If defaultGroupName is specified i.e not null and valid, then, add users from the group with name groupname to the defaultgroup before deleting the specified group
* param groupname is the group that is to be deleted
* param defaultGroupName is the default group to which the users from the group to be deleted will be added
fields.summary: deleteGroup

fields.description:
Method API - void deleteUserFromGroup(String username, String groupname)
Method Description - Delete the user with name username from the group with name groupname.
* param username is the name of the user that is to be deleted from the group with wih name groupname.
*param groupname is the name of the group from which the user with name username is to be deleted.
fields.summary: deleteUserFromGroup

fields.description:
Method API: void deleteUser (RemoteUser remoteUser)
Method Description: Deletes the corresponding user from the Confluence System
* @param  remoteUser is the user that is to be deleted from the CONFLUENCE SYSTEM.
fields.summary: deleteUser

fields.description:
Method API: addPermissionToSpace(String permission, String entityName, RemoteSpace remoteSpace) 
Method Description: Add a given permission for a particular group/user having name entityName to the given space. 
*param permission is the Permission that is to be added to the space
*param entityName is either a group or a user name
*param remoteSpace is the remote space for which the given permission is to be added for the given group/user
fields.summary: addPermissionToSpace

fields.description:
Deleting a user generates a net.sf.hibernate.LazyInitializationException.  After this you cannot enter the 'browse' user screen.  The user is deleted succesfully, but you need to restart the app server to get things behaving again.  We're using LDAP against ActiveDirectory for some users; this might be relevant.  We also had this problem in 1.1.2 but didn't report as I thought it might have gone away in 1.3.

Here's the relevant bit of the stack trace:

fields.description:
This issue needs investigation - ideally, if a quick fix and upgrade task can be made, it should be done immediately.

The below limits developer's abilities to serialize objects via Xstream and store them in propertyset - the column for text is restricted (see below).

This is also, obviously, a generic problem for retrieving and storing large amounts of data on a property. 

> Basically, the Hibernate provider for PropertySet uses the same column 
> (a VARCHAR(255)) for both string and text properties. So we'll either 
> need to fix PropertySet, or write our own provider that does a better job.
> 
> C

Also, IFF this issue impacts existing meta-data an upgrade task will have to be written. 

For the fix, is it as simple as:
- writing a new PropertySet.hbm.xml which uses a long text field (using 
our clob type)
- writing an upgrade task to move the existing data across to that new 
field?
fields.summary: Repair/replace PropertySet's Hibernate provider / provide upgrade task in Confluence for text/string meta data
Customizable default permissions for newly created space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2558].
  {panel}

The plugin system supports version requirements for plugins so you can specify the maximum and minimum product versions that the plugin will work with.

<application-version min="3.0" max="3.0"/>

* Make sure this works with Confluence - plugins outside the version range are disabled (with an appropriately displayed message on the plugin screen) and can't be enabled.
* Make sure plugins understands the following sequence of versions (write tests) 1.3 < 1.3.1 < 1.3.2 < 1.4-DR1 < 1.4-DR2 < 1.4 < 1.4.1
* Add an optional app="" attribute to the tag. If the attribute is present, but the value is not Confluence, then the plugin isn't deployed (coordinate with the JIRA guys so that they can do the same thing. This way, a JIRA plugin accidentally dropped in Confluence's classpath won't cause Confluence to complain)
fields.summary: Add version requirements to plugins

fields.description:
One idea for future of templates in Confluence:

        Rather than simply being used for page creation, templates should remain as a mediator for data entered into the page, throughout its lifetime.
  
        This will extend to custom fields (like JIRA), which themselves would be indexable by Lucene in Confluence.
fields.summary: Guiding Page templates - custom fields, etc..

fields.description:
After upgrading to 1.3.1, thousands of lines of the following error are logged daily in our confluence which uses Jira for accounts:

2004-12-29 09:49:08,103 FATAL [user.providers.jira.JiraJdbcProfileProvider] Unable to close connection: Connection is closed. 

The database used is MySQL 4.1 and the DB URL has the ?autoReconnect=true so the connections in the pool should remain open until explicitly closed.

Confluence starts to log the rows pretty much immediately following a restart so I suspect there's something funky in the startup process which leaves a broken connection into the pool.
fields.summary: Jira integration database connection issue

fields.description:
Investigate and fix!

/images/icons/emoticons/check.png

When it should be relative, i.e., without the slash.

fields.description:
For example:

<h2 style="margin: 4px 0px 4px 0px;" class="heading2">

This means that the style will override anything that the third-party user attempts to do with their own stylesheet.  The style="..." attribute should not be used in generated content.
fields.summary: Use of both style="..." in generated HTML breaks third-party CSS.

fields.description: When a macro is executed in a page which is included via #includePage (eg using the 'left-navigation' theme), it gets null back when ServletActionContext.getRequest() is called. Also, the same effect is observed when a macro is executed in the 'Site Welcome Message'. This makes it difficult to detect the current user (my current problem) as well as things like query parameters, etc.
fields.summary: Macros in #includePage calls cannot access the current HttpServletRequest object

fields.description:
I've found a few bugs in the children macro.

{children:excerpt=true, all=true} doesn't seem to work anymore.

Also,

{children:depth=5} works but {children:depth=5, excerpt=true} gives an error.

Also, the documentation in the guide is wrong - it refers to 'excerpts=true' and it has an extra } at the end of the examples.
fields.summary: Children macro bugs
